54.text: Kusama is best known for her brilliantly coloured dotted surfaces, her installations with blow-ups

61.text: and her walls covered in brilliant spots.

73.text: And in her biography she talks about experiences, really, of a very young child, almost hallucinogenic experiences

79.text: where her vision of landscape and people was clouded by spots.

84.text: And in her very, very first mature works of art, just after finishing art school in Kyoto

90.text: the spot emerges as a pattern in her work.

93.text: And, from that period of time she comes back to the spot with great regularity

97.text: and by the end of the 60s she’s actually painting the landscape, she’s painting spots on people’s bodies

119.text: and, the interesting thing about this work in particular is that, where she’s moved
